title: actually unpopular opinion: i hate both URF and ARURF
body:
not just one, both of them, normal urf is fun for about the first day or two then it devolves into 5 man premades with shitty anti-fun push comps, sure you can pick a broken champ and get some kills, have a bit of fun. but i hope you have fun losing anyway because the enemy team has an obnoxious comp based around pushing towers. 

as for arurf? it would be fun, if it was actually random and we had bans, there are too many auto lose champions you might aswell let it remake if you see them in loading screen, wow your team has yasuo and maybe a few adcs? cool the enemy team has a morg and a yi have fun with a gray screen most of the game wishing you never queued up in the first place. not only is there that coinflip theres also the fact yi and maokai are gonna be in 90% of your games but trust me you wont see a single xin zhao or leona because they basically dont exist in the mode because we all know pretty much its only kinda random, not fully 

and the more i think about the first example on urf the more i realize most temporary modes are exactly like that, its fun for 2 days till people find abuse-able champions or strats that flat out ruin the mode for anyone else not doing the same thing and just wanting to have fun get driven out of the mode completely

For real. 

I enjoyed URF for a couple of days. The third day, people started flaming me in champ select for not picking Blitz/Nidalee/Ezreal/Lux.
Original URF was available in co-op vs AI. Now _that_ was fun... I don't think I've ever had more fun with League than I did in those few weeks. I played basically all day every day.
i loved it for the first few days where the meta there wasnt very outlined, after that though tryharding sucked the life out of the mode for me

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Dog,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O4HG3RWL,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-01-22T18:05:21.509+0000)
>
> i loved it for the first few days where the meta there wasnt very outlined, after that though tryharding sucked the life out of the mode for me

Right; that's why it was a perfect fit for co-op. No need to tryhard in co-op, whether in the ordinary version or URF. The bots would launch a bunch of nonsense at you, but it was okay, because you could do the same thing. And the bots picked normally rather than going for optimal URF champs.

And then Riot removed co-op from URF, and then they removed _choosing the damn champ you wanted to play_ from URF, and then they removed the parts of Ultra-Rapid Fire that were _too_ ultra-rapid fire (like heals) rather than boosting the things that were garbage in URF (like Yasuo and Karthus), and so on.

The excuse for removing URF is that it was literally too fun - so fun that people quit when it went away. I guess ripping fun out of the game is a great way to get people to stay so that your revenue won't go down by 21%, right Riot?
No matter what game mode you're playing, it's only a matter of time until a meta develops. This isn't something exclusive to urf/arurf.
I don't even know why URF and ARURF are even a thing anymore, i mean SR is URF at this point anyway {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
Unpopular opinion, you should be able to edit every one of the game's settings in custom games like in Overwatch and DOTA 2.
Unpopular opinion: damage is too high
Yeah, then you just tone damage in the game's settings. That's what people did in OW during dive meta, they created customs where damage was reduced to 50% or lower.

800% increased damage to pink wards

Yeah the worst part is you're forced to play it 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

when all the friends you play league with do like it and you dont i pretty much either have to play it or just not play league with my friends which sucks a lot, though i dont want them deleted or anything im just voicing my opinion

Urf would have been manageble if we had bans. I hate ARURF since ARAM only accounts benefit from just taking hard poke champs. With URF being manaless and CDless it just make playing against certain champs like lux even more obnoxious than it had to. If i lose, i want to lose with the champ i picked out my own free will instead of some random one.

I hate urf but at the same time it has been soooooooooo long that it would be great to play again finally. I hate Arurf but only because it is waaaay too biased and people have been bypassing the reason why it has been made ever since its creation; the gamemode was supposed to make it so you don't see Syndra, Orianna, Zed, Zyra etc every single game, but those champs were magically in every single game either way and you couldn't fight back because your team actually had some ACTUAL random picks

I personally really enjoyed og urf with a comp of friends with the ability to ban. We'd come up with crazy stats or champ combos and have fun, and if the enemy team did some gay split pushing strat we'd just out strat them, cause that's how you play strategy games. Id honestly have just as much fun in arurf if we still got bans and there were auto bans

Yep, either Dominion or Ascension are equally fun for me.
I PREFER ONE FOR ALL TO BE HONEST BUT OK{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
URF was best when I could stunlock people as full tank brand and slowly end them with the level 1 Q that I would never rank up.
Those modes aren't about winning and losing, they are about having some mindless button-mashing fun.
So how is normal league currently different?
Non-ranked SR games are mostly for trying out champions/builds/strats, etc, and for getting the basics of the game down if you're new. URF isn't for any of that, it's just mindless manic fun.
You missed the question. Right now the meta is to button mash and instantly kill people. How is urf actually any different?

Well then maybe Riot should take a look at the ranked meta and see if they need to make adjustments. But URF is where you aren't really supposed to care that much if you win or lose, you are there mostly for the giggles and the button mashing.

Is it though? I think it's rather the opposite: No fun allowed, who can finish faster.
I've been reported in URF for picking URF off-meta and I've been flamed for underperforming on a "broken" champion in ARURF. It feels like the overwhelming majority of players playing URF or ARURF only have fun when winning and they make the game completely anti-fun for the rest if they can't have their version of fun.
I'm glad somebody said it
They should just make it a pve bloodbath where you melt waves of schmucks. People like playing AS the urf buffed champs, but I see little value gained in playing against.
Don't forget Veigar if you don't have a direct counter, that thing is basically untouchable

I had way too much fun with original URF and maybe the next one but it has got boring ever since , mostly because League itself has now become URF with 40% cooldown reduction being literally free every game and then ARURF came and it all went to shit honestly because it's soooooo much fun playing  garbage like Ashe while the enemy beats me into a pulp with Fiora.

We need to have a completely separate rotating-game-mode MMR so all the tryhards can compete with each other, all the complete trolls (it's urf, AP riven's legit!) can have fun fucking around without losing the game for their team, and everyone in between can do their thing.
{{champion:8}}  if a team has him they win.
Same. It's too fadt even tho that's it's point but I don't like hiw you get to spam spells like laser cannons in P shooting 8 bit games. :/

It's nice if it only comes once per year maximum because then it at least feels somewhat special for a few days.

But it will never be the same again like when they first launched it back in 2014.

ARURF is more fun to me because it isn't fun playing against people who are playing their OP mains. When some people get champs they aren't familiar with it sort of levels the playing field. I liked the snowball one last winter. 

But I do feel like after a few games I get really burnt out. Especially if I am on a losing streak and have bad luck several games in a row vs really oppressive team comps.
DOOM BOTS!

Does current lol really even feel different than urf? I really think cdr Damage is too easy to get in normal games.

And you know for a fact when ARURF or even regular URF is active the forums and Reddit are probably going to be full of "X CHAMPION IS CANCER IN URF". 

Riot should've never bought it back. URF was good the first time.  After that it became "pick these champs or else you'll lose and probably won't have no fun while losing".
